verses.roman:
prakaṭiyā dekhe ācārya sakala saṁsāra
kṛṣṇa-bhakti gandha-hīna viṣaya-vyavahāra

synonyms: prakaṭiyā—manifesting; dekhe—He saw; ācārya—Advaita Ācārya; sakala—all; saṁsāra—material existence; kṛṣṇa-bhakti—of devotion to Lord Kṛṣṇa; gandha-hīna—without a trace; viṣaya—of the sense objects; vyavahāra—affairs.
translation: Advaita Ācārya having appeared, He found the world devoid of devotional service to Śrī Kṛṣṇa because people were engrossed in material affairs.
